title: Safety Upgrades Complete at Key MRA Venues
author: Technical Team
excerpt: Major safety infrastructure upgrades have been completed at several Motor Racing Australia championship venues ahead of the 2025 season.
body: Comprehensive safety upgrades have been completed at multiple Motor Racing Australia championship venues, ensuring the highest standards of competitor and spectator safety for the 2025 season.

The improvements include new SAFER barriers at high-speed sections, upgraded medical facilities, and enhanced fire suppression systems. These modifications align with the latest FIA safety standards and recommendations.

Wakefield Park has received particular attention, with a complete resurfacing of the main straight and installation of new catch fencing in critical areas. The circuit's medical center has also been expanded and equipped with the latest emergency response equipment.

"Safety is our absolute priority," emphasized MRA Safety Director Dr. Sarah Chen. "These investments ensure that our drivers can compete with confidence while maintaining the competitive integrity that makes our championship so exciting."
Similar upgrades are planned for additional venues throughout 2025, with a multi-year investment program designed to keep MRA facilities at the forefront of motorsport safety standards.
